bioghist.p: Sculley Bradley (b. 1897), was a professor of English and American Literature at the University of Pennsylvania. With Gay Wilson Allen of New York University, Bradley oversaw the editing of The Collected Works of Walt Whitman.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence and other items authored or collected by Sculley Bradley. Materials related to Bradley's Critical Study of Whitman include: notes, research materials (reprints, photographs, newspaper and magazine clippings, postcards, and illustrations), and annotated galleys of Leaves of grass: A Textual Variorum of the Printed Poems (New York University Press, 1980). There is also a poster of a Whitman poem and several reprints of the Long Islander Whitman anniversary page. The collection includes personal correspondence between Sculley Bradley and James T. Farrell (1948-1959). There is also correspondence largely related to Bradley's editorship of the General Magazine and Historical Chronicle, regarding requests for articles and poems. This section also includes some drafts of articles and poetry. Correspondents in this section include Archibald MacLeish, James Thurber, John Dos Passos, and David McCord.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
